class_notes:
Content: This course offers students a review of grammar and an introduction to Greek prose through selections from the works associated with the second century AD sophist, Lucian of Samosata. We will begin with a text probably not by Lucian, but transmitted with his genuine works, The Ass, the story of a young man in pursuit of magic who accidentally turns himself into an ass.  If time permits at the end of the term, we will also read some of Lucian's A True Story (fabulous voyages and adventures beyond the then know world).
Text: 	Lucian's The Ass: An Intermediate Greek Reader: Greek Text with Running Vocabulary and Commentary, ed. S. Nimis and E. Hayes (Faenum Publishing, 2012) ISBN: 978-0983222828
Recommended:
L. Pratt, The Essentials of Greek Grammar: A Reference for Intermediate Readers of Attic Greek (University of Oklahoma Press, 2011) ISBN: 978-0806141435
Lucian's A True Story: An Intermediate Greek Reader: Greek Text with Running Vocabulary and Commentary, ed. E. Hayes and S. Nimis (Faenum Publishing, 2011) ISBN: 978-0983222804
Course Mechanics
Occasional quizzes, three (possibly four) tests, and a final examination. Classwork and homework are important components of the final grade.
Please note:  students with a conflict at the scheduled time should contact the instructor in the first week of classes to see if rescheduling is possible.
course_description: A review of grammar and introduction to Greek prose through selections from one or more authors such as Plato, Herodotus, Lysias, and Xenophon.
